reasoning: Pancreatic vipoma is an extremely rare neuroendocrine tumor producing vasoactive intestinal peptide (VIP). Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors have incidence ~0.5-2 per 100k globally, vipomas represent ~5-10% of these. Estimated ~0.15 per 100k based on case report frequency and neuroendocrine tumor epidemiology. Most vipomas are pancreatic.
